      • createResearchObject

        public static com.sun.jersey.api.client.ClientResponse createResearchObject(java.net.URI rodlURI,
                                                            java.lang.String roId,
                                                            org.scribe.model.Token dLibraToken)
        Create a Research Object.
        Parameters:
        rodlURI - RODL URI
        roId - RO ID, will be URL encoded
        dLibraToken - RODL access token
        Returns:
        response from RODL, remember to close it after use

        Create a new resource in RODL.
        Parameters:
        researchObject - research object URI
        resourcePath - path to the resource
        content - content input stream
        contentType - MIME type for the request
        dLibraToken - RODL access token
        Returns:
        response from RODL, remember to close it after use

      • getROList

        public static java.util.List<java.net.URI> getROList(java.net.URI rodlURI)
                                              throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Return a list of all ROs.
        Parameters:
        rodlURI - RODL URI
        Returns:
        a list of RO URIs
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the URIs returned by RODL are incorrect

      • getROList

        public static java.util.List<java.net.URI> getROList(java.net.URI rodlURI,
                                     org.scribe.model.Token dLibraToken)
                                              throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Return a list of ROs. If the access token is not null, returns a list of ROs belonging to the access token owner. Otherwise returns a list of all ROs.
        Parameters:
        rodlURI - RODL URI
        dLibraToken - RODL access token
        Returns:
        a list of RO URIs
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the URIs returned by RODL are incorrect

                                                     org.scribe.model.Token dLibraToken)
        Create an annotation in RODL using an existing resource as the annotation body.
        Parameters:
        researchObject - RO URI
        targets - annotated resources URIs
        bodyURI - annotation body URI
        dLibraToken - RODL access token
        Returns:
        RODL response

        contentType - MIME type for the request

      • isRoIdFree

        public static boolean isRoIdFree(java.net.URI rodlURI,
                 java.lang.String roId)
                          throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Checks if it is possible to create an RO with workspace "default" and version "v1".
        Parameters:
        rodlURI - RODL URI
        roId - RO id
        Returns:
        true if the RO id is free, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the URIs returned by RODL are not correct

      • createAnnotationBodyPath

        public static java.lang.String createAnnotationBodyPath(java.lang.String targetPath)
        Generate a path for an annotation body of a resource. The template is ["ro"|resource_name] + "-" + random_string.
        Parameters:
        targetPath - the annotation body target relative to the RO URI. null means the RO itself
        Returns:
        an annotation body path relative to the RO URI
